alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:22AM CST until February 16 at 12:45PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Carroll County in Tennessee... Henry County in Tennessee... Southern Weakley County in Tennessee... * Until 1245 PM CST. * At 1022 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paris, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Paris Landing State Park, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Sharon, Cottage Grove, Routon, Trezevant, Puryear, Henry, McLemoresville, Como, Ore Springs, Osage, Hico, Whitlock and Porter Court. Several roads in Henry and Weakley Counties are flooded including Highway 54 near Como and Highway 54 at the Paris City limits. New Bethel Road is flooded west-northwest of the town of Henry. Old Highway 22 is impassable near Gleason. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
